semantic_title: Selection of Trimester for Inpatient Admissions Spanning Multiple Trimesters
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Chapter 15: Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > a. General Rules for Obstetric Cases > 4) Selection of trimester for inpatient admissions that encompass more than one trimester

content.full_text: In instances when a patient is admitted to a hospital for complications of pregnancy during one trimester and remains in the hospital into a subsequent trimester, the trimester character for the antepartum complication code should be assigned on the basis of the trimester when the complication developed, not the trimester of the discharge. If the condition developed prior to the current admission/encounter or represents a pre-existing condition, the trimester character for the trimester at the time of the admission/encounter should be assigned. (Evidence: pg no: 64, L28-L33)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign trimester character based on when complication developed, not discharge trimester (Evidence: pg no: 64, L31-L32)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a patient is admitted for pregnancy complications in one trimester and stays into another trimester, the trimester code reflects when the complication first occurred (Evidence: pg no: 64, L30-L32)

detailed_rules.explanation: Pre-existing conditions or those developed prior to current admission use the trimester at admission time (Evidence: pg no: 64, L32-L33)
